sentence.text: ` You do n't want too much of it , " admonished the other .
` Now you must n't say things like that , " Ruth admonished her . "
` Now , Frank , " Hauser admonished him amiably .
Yer should tear 'im orf a strip , " he admonished the Captain .
` Cover yourself , Shiona , " he admonished her harshly .
But the King for prevention of offences may by proclamation admonish his subjects that they keep the laws , and do not offend them ; upon punishment to be inflicted by the law , .
Anyway , to return to the harvest supper table : I would admonish the company to eat up or , ` It 'll all go in the soup . "
Then he had sent her off to the lingerie department with the assistant , admonishing her to choose the prettiest undergarments .
But it is the parent who is forever admonishing the infant to ` be careful " who is more likely to instil fear into the young mind .
Loudspeakers admonish us to hurry to our next classroom ( up three flights of stairs and along endless corridors ) .
` Now , do n't try to change the subject , " Deirdre admonished him with a smile .
Timothy was admonished by Paul to reactivate the gift which had been bestowed upon him ( 2 Tim .
More than one sceptical senior colleague has been admonished , ` Do n't tell me what ; tell me how .
Those unfortunates who were late received two cuts from the weapon -- one on each hand and were admonished not to be late again .
The court staff have been admonished to deal with a request for postal service by solicitor as a matter of priority .
` Always start with the grid " , she admonishes with fervour , ` and then you ca n't go wrong ! " .
` You dawdled , " she admonished in her gentle sympathetic voice .
Fred Hirst , secretary of the maypole committee , was also at the bar and , overhearing this , admonished both to ` 'old on a minute " .
` Behave yourselves , " he admonished .
` Your mother does n't operate her career for your amusement , Princess , " her father admonished , pinching Tina 's cheek .
` Alright , that 's enough , " he admonishes , but to no avail , the band strikes up again .
